etymologies: late 19th century: from medieval Latin quartilis, from Latin quartus ‘fourth’

definitions: each of four equal groups into which a population can be divided according to the distribution of values of a particular variable

examples.text: in the highest quartile, the mean age was 72

shortDefinitions: each of four equal groups into which population can be divided according to distribution of values of particular variable

definitions: each of the three values of the random variable that divide a population into four groups.
shortDefinitions: each of three values of random variable which divide population into quartiles
